recipieData.title: Puran Poli
process: Boil chana dal until soft and drain excess water.
Cook dal with jaggery until it forms a thick mixture.
Add cardamom powder and mix well. Let it cool.
Prepare dough by mixing wheat flour, salt, water, and a little oil.
Make small dough balls and stuff them with the dal–jaggery mixture.
Roll gently and cook on a hot tawa using ghee until golden brown.
recipieData.description2: A traditional sweet flatbread enjoyed especially during festive seasons.

recipieData.title: Upma
process: Dry roast semolina on low flame until aromatic and slightly golden.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, cumin, curry leaves, and allow to splutter.
Add chopped onions and green chillies; sauté until onions turn soft.
Add roasted semolina and mix well.
Pour hot water slowly while continuously stirring.
Cook until upma thickens and turns soft.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.
recipieData.description2: A light, healthy, and quick South Indian breakfast made with semolina.

recipieData.title: Vada Pav
process: Mash boiled potatoes and mix with mustard seeds, turmeric, and spices.
Heat oil and sauté ginger-garlic-chilli paste, then add the potato mixture.
Shape into small balls.
Prepare a thick batter using besan, salt, and water.
Dip potato balls into batter and deep-fry until golden.
Slice pav buns, apply garlic chutney, and place the fried vada inside.
Press gently and serve hot with fried chillies.
recipieData.description2: Mumbai’s iconic street food – spicy potato vada stuffed between pav.

recipieData.title: Misal Pav
ingredients: 1.5 tbsp red misal masala or red chilli powder
process: Heat oil and add mustard seeds and cumin until they splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, turmeric, and misal masala. Cook well.
Add sprouted matki and mix thoroughly.
Pour water and simmer until beans become soft and the tari (spicy gravy) forms.
Serve matki with farsan on top, garnish with onion, coriander, and lemon.
Toast pav lightly with butter. Enjoy with hot pav.
recipieData.description2: A spicy Maharashtrian curry made with sprouted beans, topped with farsan and served with pav.

Crispy vada and soft pav. Loved it!
Perfect blend of spices and textures. A must-try!
